subject: Re: RLM CCC connect to pdwise

full_threads.body: Perfect all is working now - thanks Joel!
(Time: 15mins)

Hi Dimitri,

We can confirm that it is working now. Can you create 2 fields "subject" and "message"?

Hi Joel,

Thanks for that, I can see a test was submitted with the correct tag applied but the fields for "First Name" and "Last Name", "Subject" and "Message" did not come through to the CRM.

Regards,
Dimitri
(Time: 60mins)

Hi Dimitri,

Thanks for sending the api key,

Confirming we have hooked it up manually with elementor forms.

Hi Joel,

How did you go?

Thanks,

Hi Joel,

This should be fine. Please check.

Thanks,
Dimitri
(Time: 60mins)

Hi Dimitri,

Thanks for confirming.

Upon review, we won’t be able to use our agency license for Gravity Forms as the site is not hosted on our end. However, we’ve rebuilt the form using Elementor instead, and the code is ready for testing.

We just need access to Pdwise in order to fully test the integration.

Let us know once we have that access, and we’ll proceed right away.

Hi Joel,

Yes update the form to GF and connect to pdwise please.

Thanks,
Dimitri

Hi Dimitri,

We are able to logged in now using the same password without the "—".

Regarding the site:

  1. We have updated the https://rlmccc.com.au/book-appointment/
  2. The form is currently in klaviyo-form, we won't be able to hook it up with pdwise, unless we rebuild the form on a different form type. Let me know if we could update this with gravity forms or something similar?

Hi Dimitri,

We are still having trouble logging in, do you have sftp/ftp logins or cpanel?

Hi Joel,

Have you completed the integration? I haven't seen any test contacts come through? If you need a tag make it "Web Enquiry".

Please confirm.

Thanks,
Dimitri
